cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 315 mi SE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move west‐northwest today, then turn northwest and north-northwest into the eastern Gulf of Mexico, aiming toward the west coast of Florida after crossing western Cuba.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for the Cayman Islands; Tropical-Storm Watch for Jamaica
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for the U.S. coast at this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Highest impact during the 5-day period expected along western Cuba and the Florida peninsula/Gulf coast; no direct coastal impacts indicated for Georgia coast in current cone.
weather_observation.wind: Low but increasing chance (up to 18% in 5 days) of experiencing tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) gusts late next week.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None anticipated for the Georgia coast in current forecast cycle.
weather_observation.rainfall: No significant rainfall (≥4 inches) currently forecast for coastal Georgia from Ian in the next 5 days.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and long-period swells possible late week even without direct landfall, which could affect pilot boarding and container crane operations.
